snippet: Ghana has begun cracking down on Chinese migrants who have overstayed their visas in the hope of getting wealthy in one of Africa’s richest gold fields.
abstract: At least 169 Chinese gold miners in Ghana have been rounded up by the government, accused of sneaking into the country and overstaying visas to illegally mine one of Africa's richest gold fields; mass roundups, which are spurred on by popular resentment toward Chinese miners, are threatening Ghana's important economic relationship with China.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and YITING SUN
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Dakar, and Yiting Sun from Accra, Ghana. Chris Stein contributed reporting from Accra.

lead_paragraph: Ghana has begun cracking down on Chinese migrants who have overstayed their visas in the hope of getting wealthy in one of Africa’s richest gold fields.

headline.seo: Ghana Cracks Down on Chinese Gold Miners
headline.main: Chasing a Golden Dream, Chinese Miners Are on the Run in Ghana
